title: Can I share a Kindle eBook? - Quora

response.answer_text: All books purchased through the Kindle Store are potentially lendable, using the “My content and devices” section of Amazon. Caveats - not every book is lendable, I believe the term is 2 weeks and each qualifying book (at the time I last checked) could only be lent once. TLDR: Yes, but not all, and with significant exceptions.

Yes but in very limited range, your family members. You can read this guide about how to share a kindle book: How to Share Kindle Fire Books with Friends (Kindle books = Kindle Fire books)
Yes, you can. Here are the top three ways to share Kindle books with friends for your reference: Top 3 Ways to Share Kindle Books with Friends
Sometimes, not all publishers agree to it. Go to manage devices and content. Check the book you want to loan, next click on the actions column. Choose loan book and follow the directions.
